intro: Lotononis decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive lotonon, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are often mistaken for other species, hence its common name. It grows in humid, shaded areas and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both botany and ecology.
